body_html:
@gngdb Great to hear that it functions in practice, but somewhat worrying that the tests are failing.

Thought I pushed a fix for CUDA, but .type_as(input) seems to be failing - is there a bug because type_as does self.type(tensor.type()), but tensor.type() now seems to require an argument @soumith? Searching for type_as in this repo brings up quite a few hits, so either I'm missing something or tests are failing to catch this 😕
body_text:
@gngdb Great to hear that it functions in practice, but somewhat worrying that the tests are failing.
Thought I pushed a fix for CUDA, but .type_as(input) seems to be failing - is there a bug because type_as does self.type(tensor.type()), but tensor.type() now seems to require an argument @soumith? Searching for type_as in this repo brings up quite a few hits, so either I'm missing something or tests are failing to catch this 😕
body:
@gngdb Great to hear that it functions in practice, but somewhat worrying that the tests are failing.

Thought I pushed a fix for CUDA, but `.type_as(input)` seems to be failing - is there a bug because `type_as` does `self.type(tensor.type())`, but `tensor.type()` now seems to require an argument @soumith? Searching for `type_as` in this repo brings up quite a few hits, so either I'm missing something or tests are failing to catch this :confused:
